p: Fungal spores were preserved at -80°C in 10% glycerol. These were inoculated in PDA medium (potato, dextrose, agar) to promote germination and mycelial growth. After 15 days, a 0.7 cm 2 plug from the outer zone of the colony was punched with a sterile well cutter and transferred to new PDA culture plates and incubated for one week in total darkness at 28°C using a CB 210 CO 2 incubator (BINDER ™). Mycelium was peeled off from the agar surface with a scalpel and DNA was extracted using a previously reported method [ 59]. DNA concentration was calculated using a NanoDrop 2000 (Thermo Scientific) spectrometer.
